wiki.content: According to the Back in the USSR Songfacts, this was inspired by the The Beach Boys song, California Girls. During the recording session on 22 August 1968, Ringo Starr walked out and announced that he had quit. "Back in the U.S.S.R." was recorded without Starr, with McCartney primarily responsible for the drum parts. McCartney's drums are most prominent in the mix, but both Lennon and Harrison recorded drum tracks for the song; these are audible in the left channel of the stereo mix. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: According to the Back in the USSR Songfacts, this was inspired by the The Beach Boys song, California Girls. During the recording session on 22 August 1968, Ringo Starr walked out and announced that he had quit. "Back in the U.S.S.R." was recorded without Starr, with McCartney primarily responsible for the drum parts. McCartney's drums are most prominent in the mix, but both Lennon and Harrison recorded drum tracks for the song; these are audible in the left channel of the stereo mix.

track.name: Back in the U.S.S.R.
comments: Back in the US? Back in the US? Back in the USSR! [24]
The Beatles have such a knack for selecting great and energetic tracks to start off an album. They do it on every one of their records. This one is no different.
Back in the US? Back in the US? Back in the USSR! [23]
Back in the US? Back in the US? Back in the USSR! [22]
i remember that my parents thought the beatles were communists because of this song--
Kicks the Beach Boys in the teeth kinda x2
(you don't know how lucky you are, boys)
great song from the white album
Kicks the Beach Boys in the teeth kinda
this song wasn't exactly a hit because of the cold war but it still had alot of airplay considering..
Back in the US? Back in the US? Back in the USSR! [21]
White album perfection. George Martin's genius work once again.
